inn1.comm: good length around off stump and angling away at 128 kph, Petersen meets it on the front foot and blocks
on a good length once again, pitching around off and shaping away, 129.5 kph that was, Petersen stays in his crease and lets it go past

fuller and straighter from Malinga at 130 kph, Petersen plays from his crease, dabbing the ball into the leg side, there could have been a single on offer but there was no inclination to run from the batsmen
Petersen lets another good length ball shape away from him outside off stump
good length and straight, Petersen stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
length ball outside off stump, Petersen punches through the gap at cover point to get going
117 kph, on a good length outside off stump, that floated through to the keeper after Petersen let it go
strays down leg side at 116 kph, such a friendly delivery, Petersen moves across his stumps and glances, the ball goes off a thick inside edge to the fine leg boundary
a better length and line, outside off stump, Petersen shoulders arms
a loud appeal for lbw after Petersen pushes forward to defend a good length ball which angled into him, he was hit on the pad outside off stump
116 kph, Peter comes forward and the bat face closes as he plays a good length ball towards midwicket
defended from the crease on the leg side
Malinga was looking for the yorker but ended up bowling a half-volley on the pads, de Kock helps himself, clipping off his pads through square leg
a full toss outside off stump now, but de Kock merely pushes this into the off side, no power at all
played from the crease into the covers
short of length outside off stump, Petersen stays in his crease, gets tall and plays towards cover
driven to extra cover and Petersen calls his partner through because Mahela is a bit slow in approaching the ball
a full ball on off stump, de Kock leans forward and drives to cover
short of a length on the hips, and at Mathews' pace, Petersen has ample time to move across his crease and glance to fine leg

another loud appeal for lbw after Petersen moves across his stumps to play towards square and is hit on the pad by a good length ball that angles into him, that was a bit high but from the umpire's face he seemed to think it was close
played towards mid-off from the crease
a full ball outside off, de Kock eases on to the front foot and square drives to point

a poor ball, a loose shot and Dilshan's dropped a straightforward chance at first slip. Mathews bowled it full and wide outside off, it was there to be driven but de Kock went after it without proper footwork, reaching far away from his body, the thick edge flew to Dilshan's left at chest height and he dropped it
defended on the leg side

caught behind! The bouncer works for Malinga. Petersen tried to hook it but only ended up gloving it to the keeper. That's the first short ball Malinga's bowled today and it's brought the first wicket for Sri Lanka. Petersen was early on the shot.
the slower ball on a good length outside off stump, that was 114 kph, only 2ks slower than what Mathews has been clocking, Duminy lets it go
134.6 kph, on a good length around off stump, Duminy stays in his crease and plays the ball to the fielder at short cover
defended on the off side

that's a half-shot but it's got him off the mark, Duminy began to play at a good length ball outside off but then stopped his shot, he didn't take his bat out of the line though and the ball thudded off the face towards third man
137 kph, the full ball swings into the left-hander and hits the pad after de Kock misses the flick through midwicket, Malinga appeals but that was missing leg
the pace is still only 117 kph but it's causing problems. Mathews gets the ball to seam across the left-hander after pitching on a good length around off and middle, Duminy pokes and is beaten
drives straight and the ball hits the stumps at the bowler's end, de Kock was well out of his crease while backing up but Mathews wasn't close to getting a hand on that
left alone outside off stump
Duminy stays back and prods outside off stump, the ball goes between gully and point off an outside edge

another edge, this time while de Kock plays a cover drive to a good length ball, the ball goes wide of first slip and Malinga does the fielding at third man, he stepped on the ball as he attempted to stop it with his boot
left alone outside off stump
the full ball crashes into the pad after Duminy plays across the line and misses, that was swinging past leg stump
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot to cover
128 kph, good length and straight, Duminy gets forward and defends with a straight bat
a full toss swings into the pads but Duminy is unable to put it away, the bat face turns in his hands on contact and the ball goes towards midwicket
a leg-stump half volley, Duminy gets proper bat on this, flicking the ball through deep backward square, Mendis sprints to his right from fine leg and dives on a damp outfield to prevent the boundary
Malinga roars an appeal after a swinging yorker beats de Kock's flick and smashes into the pad, that was doing too much and hence missing leg stump
defended into the off side
good length outside off, Duminy strides forward and defends
good length, pitching around off and seaming away from the left-hander, who lets it go
good length outside off, Duminy shoulders arms
Duminy gets on to the front foot and opens the face to steer a length ball towards gully
after bowling plenty of gentle-medium seamers, Mathews ends a maiden over with a sharp bouncer which has Duminy swaying out of the way
a full ball on middle and leg, de Kock stays in his crease and drives the ball to mid-on
a short ball and de Kock attempts to pull, he mis-times it towards midwicket, the ball arrived later than he expected
a full toss on the pads, de Kock flicks it through the gap at midwicket, didn't try and smash it but placed it well and timed it superbly
another full toss, this time de Kock ends up slicing it on the off side, he did not time this one
in the blockhole outside off stump, de Kock was on the front foot and a bit late in bringing his bat down, the ball hit the inside part of the bottom and just missed the stumps
another swinging yorker and de Kock jams his bat down on it in time
good length, pitching on leg and seaming across, Duminy strides forward and defends
Duminy sees the ball seaming wide outside off stump and so he goes after it with a flamboyant cover drive, he is beaten. The length wasn't there for the drive
he's hit this well, moving forward to a length ball that moves away and driving on the up through cover, the line was a bit closer to him compared to the previous delivery
pitches on a good length and seams across Duminy, ho shoulders arms
Dminy lets another one go outside off stump
short and wide outside off, not as much of a challenge for the batsman, Duminy cuts through point for the second boundary of the over
defended from the crease
played off the back foot through point
pushed tentatively towards cover on the front foot, Duminy was early on the shot and ended up playing it uppishly
defended on the leg side from the crease
Duminy goes back and works the ball with the angle into him from round the wicket through square leg
played from the crease towards short cover
a length ball on leg and middle, Duminy stays in his crease and works the ball through square leg
short of a length this time, the line is wicket to wicket, de Kock stays back and works the ball square on the leg side
a fuller length on middle and off, Duminy defends on the front foot
good length on leg and middle, Duminy leans forward and plays towards midwicket
a fuller length around off, Duminy leans forward and across and drives towards mid-on
Duminy moves across his stumps and tries to dab past first slip, he can't beat the fielder though
a gentle full toss and de Kock makes a mess of that shot, ends up chipping it tamely in the air and luckily for him it falls short of Mendis at long-on
a short ball and Duminy sweeps that from around off stump the the fine-leg boundary
a fuller ball and Duminy drives off the front foot past the bowler, it was in the air and Dilshan dived to his left, over the top of the ball
shorter length and the batsman cuts through point
another sweep, this time to the fielder at deep square leg
cut off the back foot in front of point

too full, on leg and middle stump, de Kock moves forward and plays a forceful on-drive, placing the ball wide of the fielder at mid-on, Herath gives chase and the outfield is slow, he reaches the ball and pulls it back, but then he slips as he tries to ensure the ball stays in play and his feet touch the boundary as he is touching the ball, so that will be four
a good length ball outside off, de Kock tries to cut but is cramped for room and beaten

caught behind! Perera gets the ball to lift at pace from a good length, de Kock is caught on the crease and begins to play at it, he then stops his shot but leaves the bat hanging outside off stump, the edge flies through to Sangakkara, who takes his second catch
a full ball outside off, AB drives from his crease to cover
130 kph outside off stump, de Villiers lets it go
good length outside off, AB moves towards the ball and plays it back to the bowler
fired wide outside off stump, Duminy cuts off the back foot and gets a bottom edge into the ground
defended from the crease on the leg side
Sangakkara appeals loudly but Mendis does not, Duminy was hit plumb in front but that was off the inside edge
defended front in front of the stumps on the leg side
Duminy gets down low and sweeps to deep backward square leg
AB leans forward and across and drives the ball to midwicket
a length ball on middle and off, Duminy stays in his crease and nudges the ball towards square leg
a length ball outside off, AB eases forward and plays the ball into a gap at cover
good length and straight, Duminy gets behind the line and defends to the bowler with a straight bat
played on! Duminy tried to run a good length ball down to third man but it was a bit too close to him and he got an inside edge on to his stumps. South Africa's steady start is unraveling
a full ball around off stump, defended on the front foot by Faf, who is the new batsman at No. 5
that was 134kph and it took off from a good length outside off stump, Faf lifted his hands out of the way
AB gets on to the front foot and defends on the leg side
that's the one that goes away from the right-hander, AB gets forward and drives on the up through cover
Faf plays slightly inside the line to one that leaves him, he manages to open the face and steer the ball past first slip
leg-stump line, a much easier delivery to play and AB clips it through square leg
that's the offbreak and Faf moves across his stumps to block on the leg side
played off the back foot to cover

a huge appeal for lbw and the umpire says not out. The Sri Lankans are asking for a review. The front foot is okay. The ball was on a good length on middle and leg and it angled into the right-hander. AB played across the line and missed. There was no bat on it but the impact was high. Replays indicate the ball would have clipped leg stump but that's an umpire's call so the decision stays with that of the on-field umpire. AB bats on.
good length and straight, AB stays in his crease and defends on the off side
driven off the front foot through cover point
AB is very early on to the front foot and half-way through his shot by the time the ball reaches him, he ends up chipping it uppishly towards mid-on
defended from the crease on the leg side
length, ball outside off stump, AB comes forward and defends
AB moves forward and defend with a straight bat
a bit on middle and leg, AB flicks towards square leg
driven off the front foot to long-off

Herath slowed that up beautifully, tossing it up and dragging Faf forward, the ball pitched on off and spun past the outside edge of the front foot defence, Sanga takes off the bails and appeals for a stumping. The decision goes up to the third umpire; Faf's back foot is grounded
played to midwicket for a single
driven on the front foot through cover
good length outside off, left alone by the batsman
a solid straight drive, AB moves forward and presents a delightfully straight bat to a length ball outside off and sends the ball racing between the bowler and mid-off
wider outside the off stump, AB lets it go
a fuller ball just outside off, AB dabs towards point and runs a risky single, a direct hit at the striker's end would have been close
Faf has a dash at a length ball outside off, it's not that wide though and he is beaten
worked off the hips through square leg
defended on the front foot
steps out of his crease and drives through the line to long off
once again the batsman comes out and drives the ball, to long on this time
Faf closes the face of the bat a bit too early on the front foot and the flighted ball hits the leading edge and goes on the off side

a horrible mix-up between the batsmen but the throw is made to the wrong end. Faf just dabbed the ball towards silly mid-on and the batsmen attempted a risky single. Both the batsmen were half way down the pitch by the time they decided to turn back. Had Herath thrown at the bowler's end AB was a goner because a fielder had come up to the stumps. Instead he threw to Sanga, and Faf was back in time
defended on the off side
AB moves across and chips the ball gently towards square leg
good length on middle and off, Faf taps the ball towards midwicket
a length ball outside off, AB moves across and drives the ball to mid-on
there's width outside off and Faf reaches for the ball and slashes through point
short of a length outside off, AB stays back and guides the ball to third man
straighter line, Faf works the ball off his pads through square leg, six singles in that over
defended on the off side
tossed up on middle stump, driven towards long on off the front foot
played off the front foot towards cover
stays back to a fuller ball and defends on the off side
tossed up on off stump, the batsman moves forward and opens the face to steer towards point
played off the front foot towards point
a gentle drive to long on off the front foot
tight line and length on off stump, AB defends towards the bowler
played off the back foot towards midwicket where Dilshan dives to his left to save the single
and Herath gives one away with a fumble at short fine leg
tossed up outside off, a half volley, Faf eases on to the front foot and plays a graceful cover drive all along the ground to the boundary
defended on the back foot on the off side
AB comes down the pitch and plays the ball towards the bowler
nudged from the crease behind square leg
defended on the front foot
flatter and faster, the batsman goes back to defend
played off the back foot but it doesn't get past point
a loud appeal after Faf comes out of his crease and gets hit on the pad, it looked straight but he was so far out that no umpire would give that
played back to the bowler from the crease.
driven on the front foot towards cover
tossed up on middle stump, Faf stays in his crease and plays towards long on
nudged off the pads through square leg
Faf stays back and punches the offbreak to cover
tight line and length on middle and off, Faf defends back to the bowler

that's a ripper! Herath drifts the flighted ball into the right-hander, pitches on middle and rips it past the outside edge. AB prodded forward and the ball seemingly took the outside edge past the keeper and to the third man boundary
driven to long on for a single
Faf steps out and drives towards mid-off
that was the arm ball and AB got an inside edge on to the pad, he was looking to play on the leg side

I think Faf's been run out! AB played the ball into the covers and called his partner through for a risky single. Chandimal was quick to get to the ball and he picked up and threw swiftly to the keeper. Faf is extremely quick between the wickets but he was an inch short. A severe set back to an innings already struggling for momentum.
tossed up on off stump, defended from the crease
driven to long off for a single
Behardien gets going by moving back and nudging a ball off his pads behind square
punched off the back foot in front of point
a full toss, and it's driven to mid-off
dabbed off the front foot towards point
driven off the front foot between the bowler and the non-striker for a single
AB drives fluently but to the man at short cover
played off the front foot into the covers again
defended on the front foot to the bowler
AB gets on to the front foot and defends with a straight bat
loud calls of wait and no after AB pushes into the covers, that would have been another risky single
defneded on the front foot towards point

that's out, but I'm not sure how exactly just yet. The umpire is asking for TV replays, so maybe it's a stumping. Mendis bowled an offbreak that drew Behardien forward and then the ball spun through the gap between bat and pad. Replays show that the ball clipped the off bail on its way into Sanga's gloves so the question of a stumping does not arise. Behardien's been bowled and South Africa slump further and further.
Mendis slides the offbreak past the left-hander's bat from over the wicket and Sanga whips off the bails. Miller's foot was fine
pushed off the front foot through cover, more of a firm defence that travelled quite a bit
driven off the front foot through point
punched off the back foot towards long on
tossed up on leg and middle, defended back to the bowler
AB strides forward and presents a straight bat while defending
tossed up on middle, AB drives on the front foot to long off
an attacking shot after what has been an age! Miller steps out and lofts Herath over mid-off, hitting through the line and timing the ball well
defended on the front foot on the off side
steps out of his crease and works the ball off the pads through square
defended on the off side
played off the pads through square leg
worked off the pads through square by the right-hander this time
a full toss and Miller plays it with a straight bat to long on
defended to midwicket, Miller sets off, AB sends him back
played to long of for a single
and another drive to long off ends the over
Miller strides forward and pushes the ball to point
Miller goes back and plays inside the line of a ball that pitches outside off and spins away from the left-hander from round the wicket
this one is aimed at the pads and does not turn, Miller tries to defend but is hit on the pad
dabbed close on the off side for a quick single
worked off the pads to square leg
AB is on to the front foot a bit too early and the offbreak spins and hits the top of his front pad
the first ball of the fielder restrictions is driven to long off, where there is a fielder
a poor ball, he was looking for the yorker but ended up bowling a half volley on the pads, clipped to the fielder on the deep square leg boundary
a thigh-high full toss, AB was caught by surprise and he defends towards midwicket
driven down the ground for another single. How will Ab approach this Powerplay? He needs to be uber careful about preserving his wicket.
short of a length around off, played with an open face to third man
a full toss on leg stump, AB does not miss out on this one, flicking it into the gap on the midwicket boundary
Dilshan beats Miller's outside edge on the front foot defence with the offbreak and Sanga breaks the stumps, the umpire asks for TV replays, which show that Miller's back toe did not leave the crease
driven on the front foot on the off side
short ball outside off, Millier hits it hard but cant beat cover, he's missed out there
played off the back foot to cover again, can't beat the infield
bowled slowly on middle, Miller defends on the front foot
Miller slaps the ball hard of the back foot towards extra cover where the fielder dives to his right to bring it down, that would have been four otherwise
Malinga resumes post drinks with a bouncer, Miller evades it
the slower ball with width outside off, Miller cuts off the back foot and Chandimal lets it go through him at point to allow a boundary
Miller steps out to drive but gets beaten by a dipping full toss, that was very close to off stump
another one so so close to off stump, Miller tried to drive again but was beaten by a full ball, not much swing into the left-hander for Malinga with the old ball
several full balls followed by a bouncer, Miller tries to chip it over the keeper but does not connect
Miller attempts to drive another full ball but gets an inside edge on to his pad
worked of the front foot through midwicket for a single
Ab tries to work the ball of his pads but misses, Dilshan appeals but that was missing leg
that's a wide down leg side, first one of the day I think
driven off the front foot towards mid off
played off the pads in front of square leg
short ball around off, Miller goes back and hits it to long off
AB begins to move towards leg to make room and then he stops and moves across his stumps to nudge the ball to short fine leg
good length on middle and leg, AB works the ball off the pads through midwicket
a full ball outside off stump, Miller leans forward and drives firmly towards wide long-off, where Angelo Perera runs to his right and tumbles to field well, he gets up fast and releases quickly
driven of the front foot once again towards long off
played from the crease to long on for a single
Miller bends his knees to get under a bouncer
another short ball, this time Miller tries to get under it and chip it over Sanga, he makes no contact
steps out of his crease and drives towards wide long on
short ball outside off, Miller goes back and gives it a whack through cover
played off the back foot towards midwicket
goes back and across and works the ball off the pads behind square
tossed up on middle and off, Miller drives from his crease between the bowler and the non-striker
driven through cover for a single
Miller waits for the ball to slide across him and hen dabs late to short third man
worked off the pads through midwicket

AB's gone! And what a time for Sri Lanka to strike! Mendis pitched around off and spun the ball away from the right-hander, AB played inside the line and edged it to Sanga. AB put in so much hard work but has fallen just when he would have wanted to accelerate.
left alone outside off stump
cut off the back foot to point
played to long on for a single
pushed forward tentatively and the outside edge runs to third man
defended from the crease towards cover
driven off the back foot to long off for a single
Peterson goes back to play towards point but bottom edges it into the ground, that came on to him slowly
pushed on the off side for a single
Miller nudges the ball into the vacant midwicket region and asks Peterson to wait because Dilshan was chasing after the ball. After some hesitation from both batsmen, they decide to run
not much room to work with but Miller waits on the back foot and cuts hard to point, doesn't beat Dilshan, who moved to his right to stop a boundary
played back to the bowler
played off the front foot to midwicket
Peterson tries to cut but mis-times it again

bowled him! Mendis pitched the offbreak on middle stump and Peterson did not read it. The previous ball had come back into the left-hander and this one went away. Peterson closed the face and the ball spun past the bat to hit off stump
defended on the front foot
played towards mid off for a single
punched off the front foot towards cover
a full ball and it is driven straight down the ground, long on will cut t off though
driven off the back foot to long off
defended on the front foot on the off side
Miller leans forward and taps the ball towards mid-on for one more
Miller steps out and drives a full ball along the ground to long on
a full toss, driven to long on again
Miller stays back and tries to work the ball towards square leg, he gets hit on the thigh
dabbed off the front foot towards backward point
played off the back foot through cover point
Miller nudges the ball off his pads behind square, Mendis finishes his spell for today
full and straight, driven from the crease to long off
driven off the front foot in front of point
Miller went back to cut but was beaten by one that pitched outside off and came in with the arm, that nearly bowled him
defended on the off side
Miller pushes forward to defend but is beaten by the offbreak as it spins away from him
nudged into the off side for a quick single
good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended from the crease
Miller's teed off! Stepping out of his crease to a short ball and clubbing it over wide long-on. If it's in the arc ... that's the first six of the game.
a short of a length ball and Miller adjusts to the slightly low bounce by swivelling and pulling though square leg, the batsmen put pressure and Mahela fumbles in the deep, allowing the single
a full toss and Miller plays it off the pads behind square
short of a length and straight, McLaren rides the bounce and dabs it down towards point
played with soft hands towards point for a single
McLaren aims for the big heave over midwicket but is beaten outside off
McLaren once again plants his foot forward and heaves across the line and misses, that was really close to off stump
pushed from the crease towards cover, three dots so far
he goes back and clubs the ball to long on, the first run is taken quickly and so they can come back for another
nudged towards point for another single
defended on the front foot to cover
a low full toss and McLaren clips it to the fielder at midwicket, he needs to give Miller the strike
a full ball outside off, McLaren drives from the crease to long off

Miller gets hit on the shoulder, he was expecting the yorker and moved forward but Malinga sent down the short ball. Miller flinched as the ball thudded into him and then went to third man. He was taking evasive action but they should not allow runs for that
played back to the bowler
this bouncer is way too high, the second wide of the innings
in the blockhole on middle stump, McLaren digs it out on the off side for a single
Miller gets to his fifty by cutting a short of a length ball to third man, it reaches the fielder on the first bounce
starts with a half-volley on leg stump, Miller waits in his crease and flicks the ball to the backward square leg boundary
that's immense! The ball is full and straight, Miller clears his front foot and launches the ball over the straight boundary ... if it's in the V, it's in the tree.
that's gone too! A short ball and Miller will hit them all day, he stays supremely balanced in his crease and pulls over the deep midwicket boundary
a full ball down leg side, Miller will be disappointed he did not get bat on that, he only had to beat short fine leg. Instead the ball hits the pad and goes to that fielder
short of a length outside off, McLaren dabs to short third man and runs
a low full toss on middle and leg, Miller clubs it along the ground to deep midwicket, he will keep the strike to face Malinga in the final over
terrific shot! Miller was on the front foot and Malinga tried to counter with the short ball, Miller got on top of the bounce and sent the ball racing to the midwicket boundary with a fierce pull
you can't bowl full to Miller, not unless you ant to fetch it. Miller gets under a full one and drives it cleanly over the long-on boundary, superb timing
in the blockhole, an excellent comeback from Malinga and Miller can only dig it out towards midwicket
another one in the blockhole and McLaren plays it towards midwicket to give the stage back to Miller

that's flat, has it got the height to clear the man at long-on? Just about! Miller gets under another full ball and slams it hard, the fielder was on the edge of the boundary and even if he had caught it the power would have taken him over the rope
Miller finishes the innings by driving one from the blockhole to long off

inn2.comm: short of a length outside off with bounce and seam away from the left-hander, Tharanga lets it go
pitches on a good length outside off and jags into Tharanga, he lets it go through to de Kock
143kph, the ball lifts off from a good length and Tharanga lets it go outside off, de Kock collects at head height, which admittedly is not extremely high
Tharanga lays bat on ball for the first time, playing a good length ball with the angle into him from round the wicket on the leg side
145.9 kph, on a good length outside off stump, Tharanga had a poke at it but was beaten by the pace
good length at the batsman's body, Tharanga gets behind the line and blocks, Morkel opens the defence with a speedy maiden
length ball, pitching around off from over the wicket and slanting across the right-hander, Dilshan stays in his crease, pushes forward slightly, and plays to point
good length on middle and off, Dilshan defends towards the bowler
short of a length outside off, Dilshan waits in his crease and opens the face to play the ball behind point, third man runs to his right to field

a loud shout for lbw and height has to be the issue, otherwise that was gone! Tsotsobe angled the ball across the right-hander, pitched around off and brought it back into Dilshan, who was so late on the shot that the ball hit his thigh before his bat came down
in the slot for the drive and Dilshan powers it off the front foot through extra cover, too much width on offer
pitches on a good length outside off and angles away, Dilshan lets it go
short of a length outside off and Tharanga is beaten by the extra bounce as he tries to steer to third man
a fuller ball outside off and Tharanga is beaten once again as he prods from his crease
pitches on a good length outside off and darts in a touch to the left-hander from round the wicket, Tharanga shoulders arms
141kph, Tharanga stays put in his crease and ducks under the bouncer
not yet, once again the length is good and the ball bounces and seams past the left-hander's bat

what happened there? Morkel fired it in full but the line was very wide out side off, nearly a wide. Tharanga reached for it and I think he got a bottom edge into the ground. The pace on the ball was so quick that it burst past de Kock and Faf at first slip
poor line, too straight and Dilshan misses the glance but the ball brushes his pad and goes to the fine leg boundary

such a soft dismissal! Dilshan tried to drive a short of a length ball on the up as it angled across him and ended up spooning it towards extra cover, where AB de Villiers ran to his left from mid-off to take a simple catch
defended from the crease back to the bowler
good length, 132 kph, outside off stump. Sangakkara covers his off stump and shoulders arms

Sanga's gone! Caught at cover! The ball was on a length outside off and it moved away from Sangakkara a touch, drawing the left-hander into the drive. Sangakkara went after it and only succeeded in giving Duminy a head-high catch
hits a good length around off and slants across Mahela, who lets it go through to the keeper de Kock
played from the crease towards point
a fuller ball at serious pace outside off stump, Tharanga tries to cover drive but is late on the shot and beaten
good length and at the body, Tharanga plays it down on the leg side
140 kph, the ball climbs on the left-hander from a length outside off stump, Tharanga stays back and opens the face to play it down towards gully, it hit high on the bat
138kph, Morkel pitches on a good length outside off and jags the ball back into the right-hander from over the wicket, Mahela gets on his toes and takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
140 kph, on a good length outside off, Mahela lets it go
132.6 kph, on a good length outside the left-hander's off stump from over the wicket, Tharanga lets it pass
Tharanga decides not to play a shot and let a short of a length ball pass outside off
good length outside off, played off the back foot on the off side
on a tight line and length outside off, Tharanga lets it go again
a fuller ball angling into the left-hander, Tharanga plays tentatively on the leg side. He was caught on the crease and played that with poor footwork
Tsotsobe completes a maiden over. He finished with one that pitched on a good length outside off and seamed away. Tharanga shouldered arms
Morkel gets the ball up high into Mahela's ribs, the batsman jumps up to fend it down and gets smashed on the glove. Mahela already has sore fingers, which is why he wasn't at slip today
defended on the back foot
that's fast but wide outside off stump, Mahela had a slash at it but was not close to making contact, de Kock collected it above his head
good length angling into the right-hander, Mahela stays in his crease and blocks
Morkel bowls a fuller ball, the batsmen are not coming forward to him, Mahela prods from his crease and is beaten
138.5 kph, a full length on a straighter line, Mahela is caught on the crease and hit on the top of the pad, that was missing the top of the stumps
full and straight again, Mahela defends awkwardly from his crease, this is a top opening salvo from Morne Morkel

Morkel is softening them up and Tsotsobe is reaping the rewards with some tight bowling too. Short of a length outside off, the ball bounces sharply, shapes away from the left-hander and hits the outside edge as Tharanga prods from his crease. Petersen takes the catch at first slip at head height
full delivery, pitching outside off and slanting across the new batsman, Chandimal lets it go
that ball has gone between the bat and body and passed over the top of the stumps, it cut back into the right-hander
pushed off the front foot towards cover
that's a loose shot to play at 16 for 3, Chandimal chases a wide ball outside off and is beaten, he was trying to cover drive one that was not full enough
edged but wide of the fielder diving to his right at second slip! Chandimal prodded at one that was slanting across him from round the wicket and was lucky that did not go to hand
good length on middle and leg, the batsman tries to glance but is hit on the pad, might have got an inside edge as well
that's a wayward ball down leg side, he was too straight with his first ball too
good length outside off, Chandimal stays in his crease and plays towards point
Chandimal reaches and fishes for one wide outside off stump without moving his feet much, he is beaten
played with a straight bat towards mid-off
a fuller length outside off, Chandimal comes forward and drives to mid-off
a full ball pitches just inside the wide line and seams away from the right-hander, Chandimal does not drive at this one
short of a length, pitching around off and slanting across Mahela who lets it go
Mahela takes his bottom hand off the bat as he opens the face and guides the ball to third man
good length outside off stump, Chandimal lets the ball pass
a wider line outside off stump, a bit too far for Chandimal to play at
good length outside off, Chandimal covers his off stump and lets it go once again
short with width outside off, Chandimal looks for release and cuts hard, Faf is in the way at point
beaten outside the off stump, the length was good and the line slanting across the right hander was close enough to off stump to make Chandimal prod at it
McLaren pitches on a good length wide outside off, Mahela fishes and catches nothing
short and wide outside off, Mahela cuts hard and that would have been four had Faf not been in the way once again
a straighter line on the pads, Mahela stays in his crease and turns the ball off his pads to fine leg
good length outside off stump, Chandimal lets it pass
a full ball on the pads, that should have gone for four but Miller is at midwicket to cut off Chandimal's crisp flick
once again Miller dives to his left to stop a flick, the ball was full but on the pads and Chandimal did not time it all that perfectly
short of a length on leg stump, Mahela fends it off his body behind square
finally a cut reaches the boundary! Chandimal places the short and wide ball behind point, Peterson runs to his right from third man and dives, he gets a hand on it but the ball beats him
defended on the front foot on the off side
good length around off stump, defended on the front foot, that was the slower ball at 113 kph. He's been around 130 kph in this over
a length ball with width outside off, Chandimal has the opportunity to free his arms and he gets under it and blasts it over the infield at cover
defended on the back foot on the leg side
good length on middle stump, Mahela moves across in his crease and dabs on the leg side
a fuller ball on the pads, Mahela flicks it through the infield at midwicket and they run three
good length and straight, the batsman gets behind the line and defends
short of a length outside off, Chandimal cuts but watches Faf stop the shot
Chandimal goes hard at the length ball, hitting it towards extra cover where Duminy scampers to his right and dives to stop the ball, Chandimal did not time that well
he goes hard at the ball again, trying to cover drive the leather off it, this time he is beaten on the outside edge
bowled on a middle stump line, Mahela dabs it close towards square leg and runs the single before midwicket can run to his right and pick up the ball
defended on the front foot
all sorts of confusion between the batsmen after Chandimal pushes towards straight midwicket and runs. Mahela is waiting to see if the ball gets past AB, and once it does he sets off as well
defended on the off side

a massive, massive appeal for lbw. Robin Peterson is aghast the umpire has said not out. South Africa review the decision.That ball pitched in line and did not seem to turn. There was no inside edge but Mahela was on the front foot and I think that was going on to miss leg stump. It did not turn for the left-arm spinner, just went on with the arm from round the wicket to the right-hander. South Africa have exhausted their only review.
Mahela dabs a shortish ball towards point, more screams from players in the middle as Faf slides to his right and collects
good length outside off, driven to cover
Chandimal tries to cut one that is a bit too close to him and is beaten
Chandimal tries to work the ball on the leg side but misses and is hit on the thigh
a fuller ball around off stump, played off the front foot to mid off
good length outside off stump, Chandimal stays in his crease and plays towards cover point
defended from the crease into the covers. The players will take a drinks break.
Mahela simply makes room and chips the ball over the infield at extra cover
tries to nudge the ball on the leg side but misses and is hit on the pad
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
steps out of his crease but realises he isn't to the pitch of the ball and sort of pads up in the end
driven on the front foot to long off
defended on the back foot
short of a length angling into the right-hander, Mahela rides the bounce and plays the ball to square leg
138 kph, on a good length around off, defended on the leg side

Morkel appeals for leg before after a good length ball cuts into Chandimal and catches the batsman on the crease, for most other bowlers that would have hit the stumps, but for Morkel that is too high
defended on the leg side
that certainly looked quicker than the 133 kph it was measured at! It hit Chandimal's bat hard as he tried to defend on the back foot
a length ball outside off and Chandimal cuts hard, the flying Faf leaps to his left at point and cuts it off
lots of width outside off and Chandimal cuts to deep point
defended on the front foot on the leg side
that's uncontrolled from Mahela, he tried to cut it but the ball hit the top edge and lobbed over point, not even Faf could get to that
played to long on for a single
defended on the off side
Mahela punches towards long off and runs once the ball beats the fielder running in and diving from extra cover
that's cut MJ in half, it pitches on a good length outside off and jagged in, Mahela played from his crease and was beaten
short of a length with tremendous bounce outside off stump, Mahela cuts off the back foot but plays under the ball
a fuller length outside off stump, 136 kph, Mahela defends from his crease on the off side
Mahela wanted to hit that down the ground, he simply stood in his crease and tried to hit through the line, the ball flew off the thick outside edge over extra cover and fell safely in the outfield
Mahela moves back and across and defends on the leg side, the ball hits the bat near the handle
steered with an open face towards third man
chipped in the air but safely through midwicket, Mahela moved across his stumps to play that
a full ball outside off, Chandimal taps it to mid off and sets off for the run though the fielder is in the circle
Mahela plants his front foot outside the line of off and sweeps to long leg
defended from the crease on the leg side
worked off the pads between square leg and midwicket
driven off the front foot to midwicket
bowled on middle stump from round the wicket into the right-hander, the batsman goes back and defends
Chandimal punches off the back foot to cover
driven off the back foot through cover for a single
Mahela goes right back and cuts the ball towards deep point, it wasn't too short either
where did that come from? Peterson got the ball to spin and leap away from the right-hander after pitching outside off stump, Mahela was beaten on the front foot push

de Kock thinks he has stumped Mahela! Peterson pitched the ball on off stump, after giving it air to draw Mahela forward into a front foot defence. The ball spun past the outside edge and de Kock had the bails off in a flash. Mahela's foot was on the line but did he get a little bit of the boot behind just in the nick of time? It is a very close call. It think he may be out here, only fractions in it. On the line is out, but the more you look at it the more you wonder if the batsman should be given the benefit of the doubt? Rod Tucker is the TV umpire and he has given Mahela the benefit. He bats on. Was that a sigh of relief I heard from all of Sri Lanka?
driven to long on for a single
he steps out of his crease and dabs the ball on the leg side
Mahela steps towards the off side and works the ball through square leg
width outside off stump and Chandimal goes back quickly and cuts, placing it wide enough to beat short third man
on the pads this time and Chandimal glances to short fine leg
Chandimal leans forward and nudges the ball through midwicket
defended on the front foot towards the off side
driven towards long-off for a single
driven straight for another single and these two have now added fifty
driven off the back foot to point
driven off the front foot to extra cover this time
pushes forward to an offbreak that spins away from the right-hander, the ball goes off the outside edge towards third man
good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended from the crease on the leg side
good length on off stump, driven on the front foot to extra cover
what's that hit? Chandimal moved across his stumps, got down low and tried to scoop the ball. He missed and the ball hit de Kock's gloves and lobbed towards short fine leg
defended on the back foot
that one is down leg side, Mahela tried to paddle it but missed
played with soft hands towards mid-on and they sprint a single
Mahela is slightly surprised that this hasn't also been called a wide, it was down leg side too

he's bowled him through the gate, would you believe it! Mahela played for the turn away from the right-hander but it did not spin, instead it pitched outside off and went on the the arm, sliding through the bat-pad gap and crashing into middle and leg stump
Mathews strides forward and defends
defended on the off side once again on the front foot
Mathews gets forward and blocks with bat close to pad
nudged on the leg side
tossed up full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
driven on the front foot to long on for a single

a very risky single and Mathews has to dive in to get home. The throw from Faf, who sprinted in from cover, dived and threw while on the ground, was a bit weak to de Kock. Chandimal had dabbed the ball close on the off side
Mathews is beaten outside off stump
pushed off the front foot behind point for a single
good length outside off, punched off the back foot towards long on

Mathews drives the ball towards wide mif-off and runs, Petersen hits the stumps direct at the bowler's end, Mathews was home and he turns and calls Chandimal through for an overthrow for the ricochet off the stumps
good length on off stump, the batsman gets behind the line and defends

the bowling change has worked for AB! After several overs of spin and gentle medium, he brings back his quick. McLaren gets the ball to lift sharply from short of a length and Chandimal is in a tangle as he attempts to fend it off. The ball seems to hold its line around off and grazes the outside edge through to de Kock. Looks like that came off the glove actually.
Perera's first ball in ODIs is a bouncer, and he ducks under it
and that's his first run in ODIs, steering the length ball outside off towards third man
hits a good length around off and the ball holds its line instead of angling in, Mathews defends inside the line from his crease and is beaten
a bit too straight and Mathews works the ball off his pads through square
played from the crease into the covers
Behardien gets the ball to bounce sharply from a length and Perera takes his bottom hand off the bat while adjusting to defend it on the off side
Perera's debut innings is a brief one, he tries to pull one that isn't too short and the top edge lobs tamely to AB de Villiers at midwicket, there was a bit of extra bounce for the bowler
hit into the covers off the back foot
played from the crease towards long on for a single
in the blockhole from Behardien, Perera keeps it out
a length ball on off and middle, worked off the pads on the back foot in front of square leg
Perera thought of hooking that but then ducked in a hurry to let the speedy short ball pass over his head, the umpire says it is too high
short of a length outside off, Perera cuts to third man, where Peterson fields
Mathews is surprised by the extra bounce and gets an outside edge wide of first slip towards third man
worked off the pads through square leg for a single

edged and dropped! A tough chance and first slip has his hands on his head after watching de Kock dive to his right and get a glove on the ball. Mathews had pushed forward tentatively at a good length ball that left him and edged it
he lets this one go outside off stump
defended watchfully on the front foot
Perera leans forward and drives to cover
gets on to the front foot and plays on the off side
that kept a bit low on off stump, Perera stays in his crease and defends
driven on the front foot to mid off
a bit shorter with width outside off, cut off the back foot through point
good length outside off stump, driven off the back foot towards point
short of a length and the ball rears up a bit more at Mathews, who defends awkwardly on the back foot, the ball rolls behind him
defended with a straight bat towards the bowler on the back foot
Mathews moves back and defends a short of a length ball on the off side

what a poor shot that is. Mathews tried to pull a short of a length ball as it angled across him, so he was trying to hit against the line. He got a top edge that lobbed to extra cover, where de Villiers was waiting. Tsotsobe has his fourth!
Herath lets the ball go outside off
Perera ties to cut one that keeps a bit low outside off and is beaten
pitches on off and spins and bounces away from Perera as he pushes forward to defend, de Kock broke the stumps but I think he dropped the ball. Perera was safe anyway
defended towards the bowler
Perera hits across the line and forces the ball towards deep square leg
played off the front foot to Duminy
Herath opens the face and defends to point

Perera's smashed it! Plonked his front foot forward and brought up Sri Lanka's 100 by smashing the ball over the square leg boundary, he even took his bottom hand off the bat during the follow through
that's fired wide outside off stump
and again, Perera's decided Peterson's got to go. Once again he takes his bottom hand off the bat while mowing and carts the ball over the midwicket boundary
boom! Perera sees a shorter ball coming his way and this time he stands his ground and pulls over deep midwicket even though there are two fielders on the boundary
Perera has exploded on Peterson! He's dragged that from wide outside off stump and sent the fans beyond the midwicket boundary scurrying
a full and fast ball, Perera gets under it and lofts it over the bowler's head for a four

a tremendous over for Sri Lanka ends with a tremendous blow! We won;t be seeing Peterson in the attack while Perera is batting anytime soon! the last hit is the biggest, sailing into the night sky before disappearing into the fans beyond deep square leg. 35 runs off the over, the second costliest in ODIs
paddled to short fine leg
defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot once again
Herath gets on to the front foot and blocks again
Herath nudges towards point
Herath defends watchfully, and gives the strike back to Perera, whose adrenalin levels will be sky high at the moment
dabbed from the crease behind point
flicked off the pads through midwicket for a single
Herath may have been looking to steer that to third man but he ended up playing it a lot finer than intended, just past the keeper who dived to his left
played off the back foot towards point
short of a length and Perera slogs it towards long on
Behardien bounces Herath, who lets it go
Duminy pitches around off from round the wicket and turns it away from the left-hander, Perera is beaten on the cut
the quicker ball, defended on the back foot
gets on to the front foot and punches to mid-off
stays on the back foot and nudges the ball to midwicket, no fireworks so far
Herath strides forward and defends on the off side
Duminy darts the ball into the pads and Herath misses it as he tries to defend

short of a length at brisk pace close to off stump, Perera cuts and is beaten, there was a sound as the ball passed the bat and de Kock thinks it's a catch! There is no appeal from Morkel though and the umpire says not out. I think Perera had hit it
another quick ball with lots of bounce outside off, Perera is beaten on the cut again
this time he makes clean contact, cutting the length ball and placing it square enough to beat third man
defended from the crease towards point

edged and another four! Perera throws his bat hard at a full ball outside off, not sure where he was trying to hit that but the ball hit the inside edge and races past the stumps and the keeper. Perera has blazed to a half-century
on a good length and straight, Perera gets behind the line and defends
Herath quietly defends another ball on the off side, he's batting quite sensibly here
nudged off the front foot through midwicket
a short ball and Perera slugs it towards ow corner, long on and deep midwicket converge on the ball
Herath sweeps to short fine leg, some misplaced excitement from South Africa's fielders for an lbw appeal
Herath gets on to the front foot and defends on the leg side
Herath moves forward and defends with bat and pad close together
he's blitzed that! A length ball from Morkel, Perera gets on to the front foot and hits through the line, smashing the ball down the ground
good length this time and Perera mis-times the hit down the ground, ends up playing it close on the off side, Morkel runs across to field
Perera slogs across the line and this time he has mis-timed it in the air, but fortunately for Sri Lanka there's no one at deep midwicket and the ball falls safely in the outfield
that is some shot, a flat-batted slap over cover against a short of a length ball that's pretty quick, won;t find that in any textbooks

oh my word, Tsotsobe has dropped what is possibly the easiest catch he will ever get. Perera tried to pull a short of a length ball and got a top edge to short fine leg. It lobbed so tamely but Tsotsobe did not come in as much as he should or could have. He ended up having to stoop forward and was off balance as his hands reached the ball close to the ground. He spilled it. the South Africans look shocked. Pressure does the strangest things.
Perera's been cut in half by a good length ball close to off stump
dabbed to square leg and Perera thunders through for a quick single
pushed off the front foot towards point
played back to the bowler off the back foot
leans forward and forces the ball along the ground to long on
nudged off the front foot to square leg
played towards third man and Herath will keep strike
a full ball around off, played off the front foot to point
short of a length with extra bounce outside off, Herath has a swish but misses
is that Herath pulling? It is. Rocks back to a short ball and powers it into the gap on the midwicket boundary
gets on to the front foot and defends calmly now
nudged from the crease towards midwicket and they run a quick single
worked off the pads through square leg for a single
Perera goes back to the spinner an dabs the ball to short third man
played to long on for a single, Duminy's darting them in from round the wicket
bowled into the blockhole outside off stump, Herath tries to dig it out and plays to third man
nudged towards midwicket for a very risky single because Duminy sprints towards the ball, picks up, turns around and throws at the bowler's end. Had he hit, Herath was gone.
played towards square leg for a single
strides forward and defends on the off side

Perera's holed out and the ground has gone dead quiet! He tried to clear the wide long-on boundary, slogging a short and slower ball from outside off stump. I think he made contact with the bottom of the bat and it turned in his hand, slicing the ball high in the air. It isn't Lopsy under the catch this time, it's Faf du Plessis running in from long on and he catches it comfortably. Faf's been awesome in the field all night.
Herath immediately swipes at a short of a length ball outside off and is beaten
pitches on a good length and seams away from Herath, who pokes and is beaten
Herath lofts the ball towards long off, mis-timed it
knocked him over! Malinga clears his front foot and slogs wildly. The good length ball clips the top of off stump, South Africa only need one more
nearly in the blockhole, Mendis defends from the crease
Herath plays the reverse sweep to short third man

Tsotsobe has taken an excellent catch at backward point to end the game! He is pumped as he flings the ball in the air in celebration. Mendis came down the pitch and tried to hit down the ground but the ball flew flat and quickly off the outside edge, Tsotsobe moves to his right and dives to take it.
